bibl.title: Observing the Sabbath in the Roman Empire: A Case Study.
bibl.note: Examine how a small Jewish community in Edfu in the south of Egypt practiced the Sabbath from the reign of Vespasian until that of Trajan (69-117 CE), focusing on taxation: Jews in Edfu did pay taxes on Sabbath, but among the receipts of the Jewish tax, the Sabbath is obviously underrepresented.
CLARYSSE Willy, Sofie REMIJSEN and Mark DEPAUW, Observing the Sabbath in the Roman Empire: A Case Study.
